name: Django-bootstrap-pagination
body:
### Welcome to django-bootstrap-pagination It is a fork from ericflo/django-pagination to fit bootstrap pagination layout ### Installing Clone the repo ``` $ git clone git://github.com/tgdn/django-bootstrap-pagination.git ``` and install ``` $ cd django-bootstrap-pagination/ $ python setup.py install ``` You may need to have root access, then use `sudo python setup.py install` instead In your settings.py add to your `INSTALLED_APPS` `bootstrap_pagination` ```python INSTALLED_APPS = ( ... 'bootstrap_pagination', ... ) ``` and to your `MIDDLEWARE_CLASSES` add `'bootstrap_pagination.middleware.PaginationMiddleware'` ```python MIDDLEWARE_CLASSES = ( 'django.middleware.common.CommonMiddleware', 'django.contrib.sessions.middleware.SessionMiddleware', 'django.middleware.csrf.CsrfViewMiddleware', 'django.contrib.auth.middleware.AuthenticationMiddleware', 'django.contrib.messages.middleware.MessageMiddleware', ... 'bootstrap_pagination.middleware.PaginationMiddleware', ) ``` ### How to use In your view use ```python def view(request, query): users = User.objects.filter(first_name=query) return render_to_response("template.html", { 'users':users }, context_instance=RequestContext(request)) ``` ... or whatever you want In your template use ```html {% load pagination_tags %}
{% autopaginate users 20 %}
    {% for user in users %}
  • {{ user.username }}
    • {% empty %} No results... {% endfor %}
{% paginate %}
``` Then run the server ! ### How it looks like? ![bootstrap pagination image](http://i1074.photobucket.com/albums/w411/tgdn45/Capturedcran2012-05-01232536.png) ### Authors and Contributors Forked from (@ericflo)'s django-pagination
